meta.title: New York Public Authorities and Corporations
meta.description: Key public authorities that operate across New York State and City, including their governing relationships to state and city executives.

nodes.label: Public Authorities Law
nodes.factoid: State law establishing and regulating public benefit corporations and authorities in New York.

nodes.label: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA)
nodes.factoid: Public benefit corporation managing New York’s regional transit systems, including subways, buses, and commuter rail.

nodes.label: New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA)
nodes.factoid: City agency and public authority providing and managing affordable housing for NYC residents.

nodes.label: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
nodes.factoid: Bi-state agency overseeing bridges, tunnels, airports, and ports in the NY–NJ metropolitan area.

nodes.label: New York State Thruway Authority
nodes.factoid: State public authority responsible for operating and maintaining the Thruway system across New York.

nodes.label: Empire State Development (ESD)
nodes.factoid: State public authority focused on economic development, business incentives, and public–private partnerships.

nodes.label: Battery Park City Authority (BPCA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing the Battery Park City neighborhood and waterfront real estate development.

nodes.label: Roosevelt Island Operating Corporation (RIOC)
nodes.factoid: State public benefit corporation overseeing operations, transportation, and real estate on Roosevelt Island.
